title: Firefox autofill will not fill in my street address
content: No matter what I've tried I cannot get Firefox (updated always) to fill in my street address along with all the other information it fills in when I use autofill? That is the only thing that is left empty and it is always left empty no matter what site I land on. I've tried deleting the saved addresses and reinstalling new ones and editing and writing them over and no matter what I've tried it will not fill in my street address? What can I do please? I was going to add a picture but then all my info would be available to everyone and anyone.

title: Dialog box that offers to save or open email attachment does not appear
content:
In Gmail running with Windows 10, when I click on a video (e.g., mp4) attachment in an email, I get the “Couldn’t preview file, etc” screen: See image "Capture1"

Then when I click on “Download” I get the following dialog box, below, and go from there: See image Capture 2.

The problem is a friend of mine decided to check the bottom “Do this automatically, etc.” box and since then this dialog box no longer appears. Now he decided he does want the choices, but neither of us has found the way to restore the dialog box. Can you help?
creator: toothmaven

title: Problem verifying a old Firefox account and same issue with new account syncing
content:
Installed Firefox 83 on MacBook Air (2017) running macOS 11.0.1. Tried signing in to a old Firefox account on att.net and needed a verification email. Went to email and it was there , arrived correct att.net account and time but said device to verify was running macOS 10.16 and the IP address was wrongful the computer I was on. So set up new account and that went ok. When tried to set up secondary email got same problem in email that was sent, wrong MacOS and wrong IP address in sent email.

Is it ok to just ignore the OS and IP address and go ahead since the information comes in right when expected for the right email account? His it asking to verify a IP address for Firefox that I do not know how to find? I think the last computer I pulled Firefox up on was running Mac 10.something so is it just confused with the last time I used the browser?

I am older and not very computer savvy so answers need to be simple. If you can help me I would appreciate it.
creator: cev1001

title: Firefox cookies v83.0
content: I have a particular site I work with daily. It requires a cookie to allow access form any device. The cookie has a life of 3 months. In my Firefox setting I have NOT set delete cookies on closing Firefox and I have set this domain as an exception always to be allowed. This morning, and on 3 other recent occasions, I have been able to access this site but suddenly, while the PC (Windows 10 64-bit) is still running and Firefox has not been closed I find I have to re-enter the cookie from the application because it has been deleted. Other cookies are still there. Last night I did run virus scanners and CC-Cleaner BUT this cookie was there this morning and has been for 4 hours until it disappeared. On the previous 3 occasions I had not run any scanners. Any ideas? Also, as an aside, in Firefox we used to be able to click on a domain to examine the cookies - whay has this been removed?
creator: kramster

title: Firefox give incorrect login information on one computer
content: I run FF 83 on my units. It seems the more the coders "improve" it, the worse it gets. It's bad enough I can't get LogMeIn remote to work (it's just fine on Chrome & Edge) but now if I try to log into a site from two different units I'm successful on the one but the other returns an error message. Suggestion?
